CNR : CGHC010356392023 | Date of registration : 18-10-2023 | Decision Date : 19-10-2023 | Disposal Nature : DISPOSED OFF
Court : High Court Of Chhattisgarh
1165
Judge : Hon'ble The Chief Justice,Hon'ble Shri Justice Naresh Kumar Chandravanshi
Pasi v. State of Jharkhand and another [(2008) 13 SCC 133] wherein it has been held as under:- “22. It is well settled that it is neither feasible nor desirable to lay down an abstract formula to determine the age of a person. The date of birth is to be determined the basis of material on record and on appreciation of evidence adduced by the parties. The medical evidence as to the age of a person, though a very useful guiding factor, is not conclusive and has to be considered along with other cogent evidence. 28. It is

Court : High Court Of Chhattisgarh
1166
Judge : Hon'ble Shri Justice Sanjay Kumar Jaiswal

seems to be right in submitting that an appeal under Section 218(3) of the West Bengal Municipal act, 1993, lies from an order of the Board of Councillors and not from an order of the Chairman of the Municipality. In fact, the power to issue a demolition order has been given to the Board and not to the Chairman of the Municipality. We have held in other cases that a demolition order issued by the Chairman of the Municipality is a nullity and has no effect in the eye of law. In the present case, undisputedly the demolition order was
